Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black (fired reddish) below; exterior: pattern around rim consisting of short outlined tongues alternately blank and black above two lines; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number '65' is written in pencil on the interior. Tongue patterns around the rim on Chian chalices occur in the Wild Goat Style. The exterior surface of Wild Goat Style Chian chalices are heavily decorated, though the size of this sherd precludes judgement on that matter.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0133) (phase 2)
